STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 31, 2023
Frederick Walraven
ENNIS CENTER FOR CHILDREN - SAGINAW
3095 CABARET TRL S,
SAGINAW, MI, 48603-2284
Re: License #: CB730410102
Dear Frederick Walraven:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
08/08/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of
the following information:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children
are interviewed, their last names shall not be included in
the report.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed contained special evaluation reports
that included the last name of some of the children who were placed and
interviewed as a part of the special evaluation.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted one corrective action plan for the evaluation completed 5/27/22.
The only area of identified noncompliance was rule 306(4). The CAP was
submitted 6/1/22 and approved 6/6/22. There were no repeat noncompliance as a
part of this review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the approved corrective
action plan. The implementation of the plan was consistent with the plan
requirements.
Financial Overview
Financial audit did not identify any concerns. The audit indicated the agency has
adequate finances to provide appropriate services.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences and there were no identified
areas of concern.
The youth interviews with the analyst were positive and indicated appropriate
support and services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The building has adequate space to provide the required services and the record
maintenance was consistent with licensing requirements.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert that was resolved. A relative home needed a smoke
detector and CO2 detector, and the caregiver's bedroom door was broken. The
family was given new detectors and a new bedroom door was installed. Pictures
confirming detectors and door installations were received to confirm resolution.
Comments from foster parents and relatives were generally positive and indicated
the agency was providing appropriate support and services.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
08/21/2023
________________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
9/5/23

Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
4
